metadata.dc:title: Anaemia in an elderly patient: can we be complacent?
metadata.dc:creator: Díaz-Sanchez, J
Mao-Martín, L
García-Panadés, R
Martín de Vidales-Hernández, C
metadata.dc:description: We present the case of a 70 year-old patient with a gradual decreasing haemoglobin. After a careful study, a very rare diagnosis was made: autoimmune haemolytic anaemia secondary to lung neoplasms (AU)
metadata.dc:source: SEMERGEN, Soc. Esp. Med. Rural Gen. (Ed. Impr.);37(7): 367-371, ago.-sept. 2011.
metadata.dc:title: Anemia en paciente anciano, ¿podemos estar tranquilos?
